title: Prison officer who sexually assaulted two inmates freed after serving half sentence
text:

A prison officer who sexually assaulted two inmates was freed yesterday after serving just half his sentence.

Brian Johnstone, 62, was jailed for three years last year for abusing his position to prey on the men and attack them in their cells at HMP Barlinnie in Glasgow.

The officer, from Greenock, Scotland, denied the charges, but was convicted of sexually assaulting his first victim between December 2013 and March 2014 and the second from March to August 2016, the Scottish Daily Record reports.

A source close to the case said: “What he has done will affect the victims for the rest of their lives, yet he is out in one-and-a-half years getting on with his.”

Sheriff Joseph Platt, who put Johnstone on the sex offenders’ register indefinitely, said: “You betrayed the trust of the prison service and your fellow employees.”

(Image: Mike Gibbons/Spindrift)

Johnstone's victims, aged 26 and 35 at the time of the assault, recalled how he would come into their cell, often before they were awake, and touch them inappropriately.

Both men said they were also assaulted in the shower at least once, Glasgow Sheriff Court heard.

The younger victim said the prison officer once carried out a sex act on him while he lay in bed, ill with food poisoning.

(Image: SWNS)

The older man described Johnstone coming into his cell and "lunging" at him before touching him between his legs, over his boxer shorts.

Johnstone denied any sexual contact before being convicted.

He resigned from prison service and was sent to HMP Dumfries to serve his sentence.

Mirror Online has approached Scottish Prison Service for comment.
description: Brian Johnstone, who has been put on the sex offenders’ register indefinitely, was serving his sentence at HMP Dumfries
